name: Coba
headline: Dual Currency Accounts For LatAm
description:
Coba makes it easy for Mexican knowledge workers employed by US companies to earn in US Dollars and seamlessly spend locally in Pesos.

On average, a knowledge worker will lose $1,000 per year in hidden ForEx and transfer fees. In that process, their money will touch at least 3 different accounts adding time and steps along the way. These workers’ require more than simple money movement, they demand a financial solution that addresses their specific needs: banking, saving, spending - all in two currencies.

Coba allows its users to not only deposit and save their earnings in a US account, but also access critical financial services at home in Mexico - from a local credit card to integrated bill pay. With Coba, remote workers can live across two currencies... efficiently and effortlessly.

founders.name: Joseph Saliba, Founder
founders.description: I'm a serial entrepreneur, prior Search Fund partner, and founder at Coba. Husband, Father and a Gringo living in Mexico.

founders.name: Abraham Kuri Vargas, Founder
founders.description: CTO & Co-founder at Coba. B.S. in Computer Science & Technology who has been developing software since 18 years old. I've been working in web development for 10+ years. Ruby on Rails expert. I'm the author of APIs on Rails(http://apionrails.icalialabs.com/book). 3D Printing enthusiast

founders.name: Eduardo Lopez De Leon, Founder
founders.description: I am an entrepreneur with 10+ years of experience building companies around the software and technology fields in the Americas. Developer by training. Dad, Husband, Regio.

founders.name: Carlos Alberto Medellin Gonzalez, Founder
founders.description: Co-founder of Coba. Former CFO of Icalia Labs. Finance Degree from Tec de Monterrey, Masters Degree from Copenhagen Business School.

generated_description:
### Coba: Simplifying Cross-Border Finances for LatAm

Founded in 2022 and part of Y Combinator's Batch S23, Coba is on a mission to transform the way Latin American professionals handle their finances, especially those working remotely for U.S. companies. Based in Monterrey, Mexico, the company understands the unique challenges that come with earning in USD while living in a peso-based economy.

**Why Coba Matters**

For knowledge workers in Mexico, navigating currency exchange and banking can be a complex and costly ordeal. On average, these workers lose about $1,000 annually due to hidden fees and inefficient transfer processes that often involve juggling multiple accounts. Coba aims to streamline this experience by offering dual currency accounts that allow users to manage their finances seamlessly in both US dollars and Mexican pesos.

**What Coba Offers**

Coba is not just about transferring money; it provides a comprehensive financial ecosystem that includes:
- **Dual Currency Accounts**: Users can deposit and save their earnings in a US account and access funds in pesos, eliminating unnecessary conversions and fees.
- **Critical Financial Services**: From local credit cards to integrated bill pay, Coba caters specifically to the needs of remote workers and expats.
- **User-Centric Features**: Automated tax reporting, quick cash access, and payroll advances are among the many services Coba plans to roll out soon to enhance user convenience.

**Designed for Growth**

Coba targets a diverse range of customers, including remote workers, expatriates, and businesses in need of efficient cross-border transactions. The platform supports multiple currencies (USD, MXN, CAD, GBP, EUR, JPY), enabling users to convert at competitive rates while automating payments and compliance with local regulations. 

**The Team and Vision**

With a compact team of nine employees led by a seasoned group partner, Tom Blomfield, Coba is poised for impactful growth in the fintech space, particularly in Latin America. Its focus on customer feedback highlights an agile approach to developing its services, ensuring they align precisely with user needs.

**Why Choose Coba?**
- **Cost Savings**: Up to 50% savings on foreign exchange fees compared to traditional banks.
- **Simplicity and Efficiency**: Seamless online transactions without the usual red tape.
- **Scalability**: Ideal for entrepreneurs and startups looking to manage their international payments efficiently.

**Join the Future of Banking with Coba**

Coba is redefining how Latin American knowledge workers and businesses manage their finances in a globalized economy. To explore more, visit their website at [Coba.ai](https://www.coba.ai) and find out how you can simplify your cross-border banking experience. 

In a world where every dollar counts, Coba stands out as a solution that empowers individuals by making financial management less of a hassle.
